page.title: 01A REVIEW OF CATTERLINE
page.content: Our village of Catterline is 6 miles south of Stonehaven. It has a small school with 27 pupils. Last year a youth club was started. It is very good. Seven new houses are in the process of being built in a field next to the school. The highest point in our area is 148m above sea level. It is called "St John's Knap". There is a burn that flows past Catterline to the sea, passing an old mill. There are a lot of farms in our area and fishing takes place. There is only one small green fishing boat. There is also an inn called the Creel Inn. Quite a few artists have also lived in Catterline. A bird sancturay is situated on a cliff by Crawton. So you can see our area is very interesting.
